code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:pt presents with moderate wheezing that worsens in cold air x 4 weeks. patient also complains of mild cough. patient is a female aged 62 ys. Patient is a moderate drinker Denies ever using tobacco o:Height 69 in, Weight 103 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, nose = no nasal congestion, NAD, normocephalic/atraumatic (nc/at), Pulm: mild LLL wheeze o/w cta-b, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, CTA-LL, wheeze-LU, PERRL, A&O x 3, wheeze-BIL, Chest: RRR, No M/G/R a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Albuterol ("rescue inhaler") - 2.5 mg as needed for SOB, and ordered Arterial Blood Gas.

td.content: s:63 yo female with C/O moderate wheezing that worsens in cold air for 2 weeks that is frequent. patient also reports mild cough. drinks daily she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life o:Height 69 in, Weight 102 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, nose = no nasal congestion, NAD, normocephalic/atraumatic (nc/at), Pulm: mild LLL wheeze o/w cta-b, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, CTA-LL, wheeze-LU, PERRL, A&O x 3, wheeze-BIL, Chest: RRR, No M/G/R a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed Albuterol ("rescue inhaler") - 2.5 mg as needed for SOB, and ordered Arterial Blood Gas.
